newsitem.title: UK: UK govt may prop up hospital PFI with cash - report.
newsitem.headline: UK govt may prop up hospital PFI with cash - report.

text.p: The British government is considering whether to try to revive the Private Finance Initiative (PFI) in the National Health Service (NHS) by providing extra money for struggling projects, the Financial Times said on Friday.
The report said senior NHS officals had confirmed that the Department of Health was in talks with the Treasury about cash injections to close funding gaps between bidders and hospital trusts.

The PFI aims to match private and public funding. The report said the scheme had suffered a series of setbacks, with investors wanting to see much quicker returns on their capital than the NHS is used to providing.
It said that in the past year 23 hospital schemes had named approved bidders, but only two had agreed commercial terms and no final contracts had been signed.
